meanings.definition: (adjective) (of a lens) having the property of remaining in focus when magnification is changed.
meanings.sent1: The parfocal lens stayed clear even after zooming in.
meanings.sent2: Photographers prefer parfocal lenses for their ability to stay focused.
meanings.sent3: The parfocal lens was like a magic eye that never lost its sharpness.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a parfocal lens, always sharp and ready to adapt.
meanings.sent5: The parfocal lens was a reliable friend, never blurry when needed.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a manner that maintains focus when magnification is adjusted.
meanings.sent1: She adjusted the camera parfocally to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent2: The binoculars were designed to focus parfocally with ease.
meanings.sent3: He danced parfocally across the stage, never losing his balance.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to move parfocally, each moment crystal clear.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice rang out parfocally, hitting every note perfectly.
